q: CEO Google has just released its fourth quarter and fiscal year 2010 results, but buried in the details is a rather large change happening at the search giant. As part of an effort to streamline decision making and create clearer lines of responsibility and accountability at the top of the company Eric Schmidt is stepping down as CEO and being replaced by Larry Page . The official announcement states: Starting from April 4, Larry Page , Google Co-Founder, will take charge of Google's day-to-day operations as Chief
